meanings.definition: The total area in acres of a piece of land.
meanings.sent1: The acreages of the farm were vast and green.
meanings.sent2: She owned several acreages of farmland in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer joked that the acreages for sale came with free roaming chickens.
meanings.sent4: His love for nature was reflected in the vast acreages of land he owned.
meanings.sent5: The real estate agent described the acreages as endless fields of opportunity.

meanings.definition: The amount of land measured in acres.
meanings.sent1: The acreages of the park were perfect for picnics.
meanings.sent2: The acreages of the estate were meticulously maintained.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide and seek among the acreages of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The acreages of the forest stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The farmer calculated the acreages of his fields to plan the crops efficiently.

meanings.definition: The total number of acres in a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The acreages of the national park were protected by law.
meanings.sent2: The acreages of the region were known for their fertile soil.
meanings.sent3: The explorer marveled at the vast acreages of uncharted land.
meanings.sent4: The acreages of the vineyard produced award-winning wines.
meanings.sent5: The surveyor mapped out the acreages of the land for the development project.
